snippet: A brooding portrait of a bearded man that had been "buried in the bowels" of the National Gallery in London, as the museum's director, Nicholas Penney, put it, has been declared a Titian by art historians, conservators and curators.
abstract: A brooding portrait of a bearded man that had been "buried in the bowels" of the National Gallery in London, as the museum's director, Nicholas Penney, put it, has been declared a Titian by art historians, conservators and curators.

headline.main: Titian Discovered at London's National Gallery
headline.print_headline: A Titian Discovered At London Museum
